column2: Adidas online sales practice draws interest of German watchdog HERZOGENAURACH
column4: May 7 The German cartel office is taking a closer look at the online sales practices of Adidas
column5: which has banned some sellers from offering its products via sites like Ebay and Amazon.

BAC,CD&R;, Carlyle, BofA sell off remaining Hertz stake for $1.24 blnCD&R;, Carlyle, BofA sell off remaining Hertz stake for $1.24 billion NEW YORK Hertz Global Holdings Inc  said on Monday that private equity firms Clayton, Dubilier & Rice and Carlyle Group , as well as Bank of America Merrill Lynch , have sold off their remaining shares in the car rental agency for $1.24 billion.  CD&R;, Carlyle, BofA sell off remaining Hertz stake for $1.24 billion NEW YORK Hertz Global Holdings Inc  said on Monday that private equity firms Clayton, Dubilier & Rice and Carlyle Group , as well as Bank of America Merrill Lynch , have sold off their remaining shares in the car rental agency for $1.24 billion. BA,UPDATE 1-WestJet says holidays, cancellations to hurt profit May 7 WestJet Airlines Ltd, Canada's second-largest airline, said it expects revenue per available seat mile (RASM) to decline in the second quarter, hurt by the timing of the Easter and Passover holidays and cancellation of some business by travel agency Thomas Cook. 
CVX,Chevron CEO ordered to testify in fraud case against Ecuadoreans May 7 A judge on Tuesday ruled that Chevron Corp's chief executive must testify in the U.S. oil company's fraud case against Ecuadoreans seeking to collect on a $19 billion judgment against Chevron related to rainforest pollution. 
DVA,Berkshire may boost DaVita stake to 25 percent May 7 Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc , the largest investor in DaVita HealthCare Partners Inc , has entered an agreement allowing it to nearly double its stake in the largest U.S. operator of dialysis clinics to 25 percent. 
DISCA,Discovery posts higher Q1 revenue, profit May 7 Discovery Communications Inc  posted higher revenue and profit in the first quarter as its cable television networks grabbed better U.S. and international ratings. 
DISCK,Discovery posts higher Q1 revenue, profit May 7 Discovery Communications Inc  posted higher revenue and profit in the first quarter as its cable television networks grabbed better U.S. and international ratings. 
DOW,Dow Chemical receives $2.2 bln as damages from Kuwait co May 7 Dow Chemical Co said it has received $2.2 billion as damages from Kuwait's state-run chemicals company, a year after an arbitrator told Petrochemical Industries Co to pay up for cancelling a planned plastics joint venture in 2008. 
EA,BRIEF-Electronic Arts up 5.5 percent in extended tradeUPDATE 3-Electronic Arts expects stronger 2014 slate * Digital sales grew 45 percent   (Adds analyst and executives' comments, details of 2014 games)  UPDATE 3-Electronic Arts expects stronger 2014 slate * Digital sales grew 45 percent   (Adds analyst and executives' comments, details of 2014 games) NEW YORK, May 7 Electronic Arts Inc :  * Up 5.5 percent to $19.42 in extended trade after Q4 results, outlookUPDATE 3-Electronic Arts expects stronger 2014 slate * Digital sales grew 45 percent   (Adds analyst and executives' comments, details of 2014 games)  
FCX,UPDATE 4-Plains holders should vote down Freeport deal -proxy firm ISS * Freeport says committed to completing deal, no reason to raise bid 
GGP,UPDATE 1-Blackstone funds exit General Growth Properties NEW YORK, May 7 Blackstone Group LP plans to sell the 23.4 million shares of General Growth Properties Inc  it holds in four funds that were used to help the mall company emerge from bankruptcy more than two years ago, General Growth said on Tuesday. 
GM,GM plans no pullout from S. Korea but workforce a worry -CEO quoted SEOUL, May 7 General Motors Co will not pull out of South Korea but will discuss labour woes with South Korea's President, its CEO was quoted as saying by its Korean union, a move that could complicate already troubled relations with its local workforce.
